column1: #text=I ride my bike to work everyday .
#text=I also ride for pleasure on the weekends .
#text=This morning I was pedaling along and all of the sudden I could feel the gritty pavement scraping the rim .
#text=I got off the bike and sure enough the front tire was flat .
#text=Well that is bad but not as bad if the rear tire was flat and I had to take the chain off .
#text=I always carry a spare inner tube and have a pump on the frame of my bike .
#text=This was going to be easy as I have done this many times before .
#text=I loosened the lock nuts that hold the front tire in place and pulled the tire from the frame .
#text=I looked in my bike pack and found the tool that helps take the tire off the rim .
#text=When I had that off I took the old inner tube and placed it in my backpack to patch later .
#text=I then fit the good inner tube inside the tire and in reverse order fitted the tire to the rim .
#text=I next took my pump and filled it up to the correct pressure .
#text=I put the tire back on the front fork and tightened the locking nuts and was on my way .
#text=I was n't even late for work .
